valid_articles.Title: Daily Search Forum Recap: August 9, 2024
valid_articles.Description:
Here is a recap of what happened in the search forums today, through the eyes of the Search Engine Roundtable and other search forums on the web.

Google spoke about crawling, ways to make it more efficient and some questions around it. No, Google does not skip pages that are more expensive to crawl. Google Lens has this speak now to ask about this image feature.  Bing Search is testing opening searches and pagination in a new window.  Google featured snippets can show emojis.  Plus, I posted the weekly SEO video recap covering this weeks juicy news...

valid_articles.Title: Video: Google Monopoly Ruling, Ranking Volatility, Million Dollar Ad Bugs, Search Console Recommendations & More
valid_articles.Description:
For the original iTunes version, click here.

This week, we covered the big ruling that Google is officially a monopoly, a federal judge ruled.  Google search ranking volatility heated up the day after that ruling.  Google served ads for products from other merchants, paid for by other advertisers, which is why they pulled down reporting.  Google then issued million dollar LSA credits, by accident, it was a bug also - Google fixed it all.  Google Search Console has a new recommendations feature that is rolling out slowly. Bing may have had a search algorithm update on May 29th but Microsoft denied it.  There is this new SEO scam going around...

valid_articles.Title: Google Search Crawling & Improvements To Crawling
valid_articles.Description: Google posted a new "Search Off The Record" podcast yesterday on the topic of crawling where John Mueller, Lizzi Sassman, and Gary Illyes spoke about how Google crawls, some ideas on how to make crawling more efficient and some misconceptions around crawl frequency and site quality.

valid_articles.Title: Google Doesn't Track How Expensive It Is To Crawl, Render, Index & Serve Individual Pages
valid_articles.Description: There has been some confusion around how Google handles pages that might be more costly for Google Search to crawl, render, index and serve - i.e. JavaScript pages.  Google does not have a monetary budget per site, in terms of it will spend $X of crawling budget on your site.

valid_articles.Title: Google Lens Speak Now To Ask About This Image
valid_articles.Description: Google seems to be rolling out a new Google Lens feature that lets you record with your camera and also speak with your voice on top of that video. Then Google Lens will match the video or image with your spoken text to give you a set of search results or an AI Overview.

valid_articles.Title: Bing Search Testing Opening Searches In New Window & Next Tab
valid_articles.Description: Microsoft is testing a weird change to the Bing Search results user experience. Bing is testing that when you do a search from the home page, that it opens the search results in a new window, instead of loading those results on the same tab you are on. Bing is also testing opening a new window for when you click to the next page of the search results.

valid_articles.Description: Google is reportedly planning to show more ads on the Play Store under the guise of "local recommendations." This has raised concerns about the increasing presence of ads in Google's mobile app store.

valid_articles.Description: TikTok is launching TikTok Spotlight, a new feature that creates in-app hubs for movies and TV shows. These hubs will add links to relevant videos on the platform, providing more information about the content and where to watch it.

valid_articles.Title: DOJ’s Jonathan Kanter takes a victory lap after Google monopoly verdict
valid_articles.Description: The Justice Department's antitrust chief, Jonathan Kanter, has expressed his satisfaction with a federal judge's ruling that Google is a monopolist. This verdict could have significant implications for Google's business practices.

valid_articles.Title: Google Local Service Ads can now show photos and those photos can improve ad rank
valid_articles.Description: Google Local Service Ads will now display photos from advertisers' profiles. These photos can potentially improve an ad's ranking, making it more important for businesses to optimize their visual content.

valid_articles.Title: Google tests loading the short videos tab after clicking on the more videos button, instead of dynamically loading videos
valid_articles.Description: Google is experimenting with the way it loads short videos in search results. Instead of dynamically loading them, Google is testing a method where users need to click on a "more videos" button to access the short videos tab.

valid_articles.Title: Google Ads API version 17.1 has been released
valid_articles.Description: Google has released a new version of its Google Ads API (v17.1). This update likely includes new features, improvements, and bug fixes for developers using the API to manage their Google Ads campaigns.
